Dear Partners,Everyday we receive a blessing from God, even if we are not aware of it. When you take a moment to remember, you will see the many good things that God poured out on your life just today. As we recount the deeds and blessings of God, we give him the honor, respect and glory that He so rightfully deserves. Therefore, let us take time to remember what God has done and mark them as milestones in our lives. It is good to learn from the past, to live in the present, and to plan for the future. We, at Vision for Israel, want to take time to give glory to God for His actions in our lives and in the lives of our organization. Over the years we have been blessed with many volunteers and loyal employees. Many have been faithful to the vision and call to serve God, and in return they were surprisingly blessed.One of our secretaries named Sophia was born in Russia and immigrated to Israel as a little girl. She was married with one child, but had prayed for 11 years to be able to have another child. After working with us for several months, she became pregnant and gave birth to a lovely baby girl. Another secretary named Zoya had a similar past as Sophia. Zoya was also married, unable to have children for many years, and became pregnant within only a few months of working for VFI.There have been countless blessings poured out on the volunteers at Vision for Israel. More than ten couples met each other as they served together with us here in Israel. It is encouraging to see those who come to serve the Lord in Israel are so blessed. VFI is not only pouring out blessings to the people of Israel, but God is also abundantly blessing the faithful staff and volunteers at VFI. We have been grateful to witness the growth and blessings in the personal lives of our team and volunteers. We believe that we will continue to see wonderful growth from all directions in this coming year of 2023. Thank you dear friends for working together with Jews and Christians to build a better place here in the land of Israel. We honor you for partnering with us to pour out God’s blessing on the Jewish people.We invite you to build the future with us by partnering with Vision for Israel in prayer and financially supporting specific projects for this new year of 2023.

Although the income from donations decreased slightly in 2022, God miraculously helped us increase our aid by 20%! Our vision for this year is to increase our support more than ever. Poverty is rapidly growing and every 4th adult lives in poverty. We also hope to open our special rehab program for people who suffered from violence. We are believing the Lord to do many more miracles this year in and through Vision for Israel. We look forward to partnering with you to impact many more lives here in the land of Israel. For more information on how to partner with Vision for Israel and ways you can give, please visit here.

Dear friends,As many of you know, our organization helps a variety of different people in different stages of life. You also likely know the number of day-to-day tasks and activities that go into making Vision for Israel work. Sometimes, volunteers handle these tasks, while other times Barry or myself shoulder the responsibility. Some years ago, one of these tasks turned into a wonderful chance encounter.For months, our accountants had been trying to take care of a number of documents from the government’s public non-profit institution division. There was no response from this government office for some time, and we began to feel desperate. I decided to simply go to the office during reception hours and get the required documents.I arrived and was the last in line. When it was my turn, the girl at the counter called me to approach the desk. She asked me who I was and what service I needed. I mentioned my name and the name of our organization. I saw that her expression changed when she heard my answer.The truth is, I was worried. I thought maybe something was wrong. Then she asked: “What is your role?” I explained that my husband and I had founded the organization and I also now serve as the general manager. She excused herself and left for a few minutes.When she came back I saw tears in her eyes. She began to tell me her story.

Her story moved me deeply and brought me a deep sense of accomplishment and joy. This is exactly why Barry and I established VFI—to bring light to the lives of people who are experiencing difficulty. I did not hide my joy, and we agreed to stay in touch. It struck me that in the past, she needed my help while now it was my turn to ask for her help with the day-to-day tasks of the organization. VFI is a wheel that never stops turning, and only God can bring us into situations where we meet special people at unexpected times. I knew that this was one of those special people.When I came out of this unexpected encounter, I realized one thing: there is no limit to the happy surprises God puts in our lives. I entered the office worried and left with a sense of satisfaction and joy. The situation with the paperwork happened because I was supposed to go to this government office at this time and place to meet Orly.Stories like these are why we do what we do. Our purpose is to help people when they are in dark times and walk with them into God’s light. Our volunteers and partners make this possible. Without your love and support, who knows where Orly would be today? You have a direct impact on families going through tough times, and that is important work.We are so grateful for all you have done, and all you continue to do. May the Lord bless and keep you.Your friends, Batya and Barry Segal
